items.sentence: When angry, count to four. When very angry, swear.
It was hard for me to get out of bed this morning.
It was not until the next day that they found her.
It was raining heavily when I got up this morning.
It was raining when I got on the bus this morning.
Tom certainly has some pretty old-fashioned ideas.
Tom certainly needs your help much more than I do.
Tom circled the block looking for a place to park.
Tom claimed that he had not eaten for three weeks.
Have you already decided what you\'re going to do?
Have you forgotten everything we\'ve done for you?
I can\'t imagine what Tom might be thinking about.
I can\'t necessarily agree with you on that point.
I can\'t remember the last time I took a vacation.
Is it true that you\'ve never played poker before?
It hurts to have to say this, but it\'s the truth.
Tom sat on that park bench for nearly three hours.
Tom says he can hold his breath for three minutes.
Tom says he never lies to Mary, but he often does.
Tom says he wants to learn how to fly an airplane.
Tom has learned how to sing a few songs in French.
Tom is over there talking with one of his friends.
Tom knew Mary wanted John to ask Alice to do that.
I think Tom is from Australia, but I may be wrong.
I think there has been some misunderstanding here.
I thought you were going to be at home last night.
Tom wasn\'t a good enough player to make the team.
Tom wasn\'t allowed to visit his father in prison.
Tom wasn\'t aware of the gravity of the situation.
Tom ended up taking the job that they offered him.
Tom escaped from the castle, disguised as a woman.
Tom finished eating breakfast before Mary woke up.
Tom flosses his teeth at least three times a week.
Tom got a kick out of the way Mary told the story.
Tom had a perfectly good reason for leaving early.
Tom mentioned a name that I\'d never heard before.
Tom lived with his uncle before he came to Boston.
Tom lives in a small town not too far from Boston.
Tom looks just like you did when you were his age.
Tom promised Mary that he\'d turn over a new leaf.
Tom put Mary\'s suggestion down on his to-do list.
Tom wanted me to find out who you\'ve been dating.
Tom doesn\'t know when Mary will leave for Boston.
Tom doesn\'t know where Mary learned how to drive.
Tom doesn\'t know why Mary dropped out of college.
Tom doesn\'t like clubs where there is loud music.
Tom doesn\'t like to eat where people are smoking.
Tom doesn\'t need to go to Boston until next week.
We\'ve never actually been out on a date together.
What was Mary\'s last name before she got married?
We might not need to attend the meeting on Monday.
We were hoping something interesting would happen.
We were totally exhausted from the five-hour trip.
Were you really playing chess at 11:30 last night?
What can I do to sound more like a native speaker?
Where did you get the idea that I don\'t like Tom?
Are you planning to be at Tom and Mary\'s wedding?
I\'m grateful for what you\'ve done for my family.
Tom was the only one not invited to Mary\'s party.
Tom wasn\'t aware that Mary had already gone home.
I\'m the one who taught Tom how to ride a bicycle.
I\'m tired of just sitting here and doing nothing.
I\'ve already been working here for several hours.
Tom\'s commissions often exceed his weekly salary.
Tom\'s doctor suggested that he cut down on sugar.
Tom\'s eyes lit up when Mary walked into the room.
Tom\'s fall resulted in life-threatening injuries.
Tom\'s fingerprint was evidence that he was there.
Tom\'s kids were here a while ago looking for him.
Tom doesn\'t think that he can do that by himself.
Tom doesn\'t think that he needs to use deodorant.
Tom didn\'t say anything about how the party went.
Tom didn\'t say anything about that in his letter.
Tom didn\'t say anything about where he was going.
Tom didn\'t say how many people were at his party.
Tom didn\'t seem to understand what was happening.
Tom didn\'t seem to want to talk about it anymore.
Tom kicked down the door and entered Mary\'s room.
Tom knew Mary wasn\'t going to be able to do that.
Don\'t pay any attention to what your father says.
Everybody knows Tom can\'t speak French very well.
I came to the conclusion that something was wrong.
I got to the bus stop just after the bus had left.
Tom wouldn\'t even let his wife apply for the job.
We have a lot of children\'s books in the library.
Yesterday I was caught in a shower on my way home.
I heard some students complain about the homework.
I heard that Tom and Mary have both been arrested.
I hope you and your wife can make it to our party.
I hope you will correct the situation immediately.
Tom and Mary ate popcorn while watching the movie.
Tom asked Mary to help him reformat the hard disk.
Tom asked me if I had a black tie he could borrow.
Tom asked me if I wanted to go to Boston with him.
Tom began living by himself at the age of sixteen.
Tom worked as a teacher in Boston for a few years.
Tom would go to Boston with us if he had the time.
Tom wrote a book while he was living in Australia.
Tom wrote his name on the dust-covered windshield.
I\'ve already forgotten Tom\'s girlfriend\'s name.
